intro: Astephanus ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaf astephanus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
